text:
Hey everyone! I started using HubSpot, and currently watching the course "HubSpot CMS for Developers".
I have been doing everything the instructor was doing and everything was going fine until I finished for that day. Today when I returned to it I started having problem with the terminal.  Basically I am trying to create the template from the command line in vsCode with the command hs create template template-name like the instructor is doing, but I am getting error: zsh: command not found: hs

Anyone solved this problem, or knows how to help? Would be grateful!

I have used simillar commands to try and fix (the ones i found online from googling the error)
Now that I returned again, and pasted this command I get :
npm ERR! The operation was rejected by your operating system.
npm ERR! It is likely you do not have the permissions to access this file as the current user
npm ERR!
npm ERR! If you believe this might be a permissions issue, please double-check the
npm ERR! permissions of the file and its containing directories, or try running
npm ERR! the command again as root/Administrator.

I have used simillar commands to try and fix (the ones i found online from googling the error)
Now that I returned again, and pasted this command I get :
npm ERR! The operation was rejected by your operating system.
npm ERR! It is likely you do not have the permissions to access this file as the current user
npm ERR!
npm ERR! If you believe this might be a permissions issue, please double-check the
npm ERR! permissions of the file and its containing directories, or try running
npm ERR! the command again as root/Administrator.

I tryed to
```sudo chown -R $USER /usr/local/lib/node_modules```
Got asked for a password
And then tryed again and got the same error
can you just sudo npm install -g @HubSpot/cli@latest ?
not ideal but it should work as a temporary fixâ€¦
